tit.cmt: 単語の最初を大文字にしました。

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 第2次桂内閣は、1908年（明治41年）7月12日に大命降下を受けた桂が、首相と大蔵大臣を兼務して発足する。
sen.e: The second Katsura cabinet assumed office on July 12, 1908 by the Prime Minister Katsura serving concurrently as Minister of Finance under the imperial command.
The Second Katsura Cabinet assumed office on July 12, 1908 by the Prime Minister Katsura serving concurrently as Minister of Finance under the imperial command.
sen.cmt: The Second Katsura Cabinet→単語の最初を大文字にしました。
sen.e: The Second Katsura Cabinet assumed office on July 12, 1908 by the Prime Minister Katsura serving concurrently as Minister of Finance under the imperial command.

sen.j: 戊申詔書による風紀引き締めと同時に社会主義運動を弾圧、幸徳事件の摘発や南北朝正閏問題への介入、出版物の取締強化を行った。
sen.e: The cabinet not only enforced discipline by Imperial Rescript of 1908 but also cracked down on socialism; it conducted the prosecution in Kotoku Incident (The High Treason Incident), intervened the legitimacy of the Northern and Southern Dynasties and strictly regulated publishing.

The cabinet not only enforced discipline by Boshin Shosho (imperial edict, decree issued in 1908) but also cracked down on socialism, conducted the prosecution of Kotoku Incident (The High Treason Incident), intervened the legitimacy of the Northern and Southern Dynasties and strictly regulated publishing.
sen.cmt: 「戊辰詔書」→ローマ字表記と、「詔書」が用語集に載っているのでその通りにし、issued in 1908 を加えました。; it conducted→, conducted としました。
sen.e: The cabinet not only enforced discipline by Boshin Shosho (imperial edict, decree issued in 1908) but also cracked down on socialism, conducted the prosecution of Kotoku Incident (The High Treason Incident), intervened the legitimacy of the Northern and Southern Dynasties and strictly regulated publishing.

sen.j: また、徹底した緊縮財政とともに地方改良運動を起こして地方の立て直しを図った。
sen.e: In addition, it tried to put the local communities back on their feet by carrying out drastic fiscal retrenchment as well as starting the Movement of Improvement of Local Community.
In addition, it tried to put the local communities back on their feet by carrying out drastic fiscal retrenchment as well as starting the Movement for Local Community Improvement.
In addition, it tried to put the local communities back on their feet by carrying out drastic fiscal retrenchment as well as starting the Movement for Local Community Improvement.

sen.j: 外交面では韓国併合を実現し、関税自主権の回復による条約改正の終了などが日本の国際的地位向上に尽くした。
sen.e: On the diplomatic front, it realized the annexation of Korea and completed treaty realizing the recovery of the tariff autonomy, which greatly contributed to the improvement in Japan's status in the international community.

On the diplomatic front, it realized the annexation of Korea and completed treaty realizing the recovery of the tariff autonomy, which greatly contributed to the improvement in Japan's status in the international community.

On the diplomatic front, it realized the annexation of Korea and completed treaty realizing the recovery of the tariff autonomy, which greatly contributed to the improvement in Japan's status in the international community.

sen.j: 大逆事件に対する責任追及が上がると、立憲政友会との「情意投合」を宣言して、秘かに西園寺公望への再度の政権譲渡を約束した。
sen.e: When its responsibility for Kotoku Incident (The High Treason Incident) was pursued, it declared 'Joui Togo' (which means 'coincidence of mutual sentiment') with Rikken Seiyukai (Friends of Constitutional Government) and secretly promised to hand over the reins of government to Kinmochi SAIONJI again.

When its responsibility for Daigyaku Incident (also called Kotoku Incident, The High Treason Incident) was pursued, it declared 'Joi Togo' (which means 'coincidence of mutual sentiment') with Rikken Seiyukai (a political party organized by Hirobumi ITO) and secretly promised to hand over the reins of government to Kinmochi SAIONJI again.
sen.cmt: 原文には「大逆事件」とあるので、Daigyaku Incident～としました。Joui→Joi としました。「立憲政友会」を用語集の通りに修正しました。
sen.e: When its responsibility for Daigyaku Incident (also called Kotoku Incident, The High Treason Incident) was pursued, it declared 'Joi Togo' (which means 'coincidence of mutual sentiment') with Rikken Seiyukai (a political party organized by Hirobumi ITO) and secretly promised to hand over the reins of government to Kinmochi SAIONJI again.

sen.j: 条約改正の終了を機に西園寺への政権譲渡を決断し、内閣総辞職した。
sen.e: Taking the opportunity of the completion of treaty revision, the cabinet decided to hand over the reigns of government to SAIONJI and resigned en masse.
Taking the opportunity of the completion of treaty revision, the cabinet decided to hand over the reigns of government to Saionji and resigned en masse.
sen.cmt: 苗字だけなので、SAIONJI →Saionji としました。
sen.e: Taking the opportunity of the completion of treaty revision, the cabinet decided to hand over the reigns of government to Saionji and resigned en masse.
